articles.headline: Lawsuit Contends Consultant Misled Detroit Pension Plan
articles.snippet: The suit says that the actuarial consultant Gabriel, Roeder, Smith used faulty methods that “doomed the plan to financial ruin.”
articles.abstract: The suit says that the actuarial consultant Gabriel, Roeder, Smith used faulty methods that “doomed the plan to financial ruin.”
articles.lead_paragraph: With the nation’s states and cities slowly sinking in a $3 trillion pension hole, the professionals who advise their pension plans have long wondered whether the fingers of blame might eventually point to them.

articles.headline: Facebook to Spend Billions on Future
articles.snippet: Third-quarter results were strong, but the co-founder’s focus on long-term bets is making Wall Street nervous.
articles.abstract: Third-quarter results were strong, but the co-founder’s focus on long-term bets is making Wall Street nervous.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Facebook shareholders got a sobering reminder on Tuesday: It’s Mark Zuckerberg’s company, and he is determined to spend billions of dollars over the next decade on ventures that might never generate substantial profits.

articles.headline: More Renters, Less Risk for Wall St.
articles.snippet: Making meaningful reform to the financial system could require Americans to reconsider the assumption that homeownership is good for the economy.
articles.abstract: Making meaningful reform to the financial system could require Americans to reconsider the assumption that homeownership is good for the economy.
articles.lead_paragraph: Is it time to temper the American dream of homeownership?

articles.headline: Apple Pay Runs Afoul of MCX, a Group With a Rival Product
articles.snippet: Rite Aid and CVS are not accepting Apple Pay because they belong to a consortium of retailers planning to release their own mobile payment system next year.
articles.abstract: Rite Aid and CVS are not accepting Apple Pay because they belong to a consortium of retailers planning to release their own mobile payment system next year.
articles.lead_paragraph: One week after its debut, Apple’s new mobile wallet is showing promise with consumers.

articles.headline: In Liberia, a Good or Very Bad Sign: Empty Hospital Beds
articles.snippet: Liberia has far fewer people being treated for Ebola than anticipated, but health officials are hesitant to declare victory.
articles.abstract: Liberia has far fewer people being treated for Ebola than anticipated, but health officials are hesitant to declare victory.
articles.lead_paragraph: SUAKOKO, Liberia — For days this month, the ambulances from the Ebola treatment unit here went out in search of patients, only to return with just one or two suspected cases. And many times, those people ended up testing negative for the disease.

articles.headline: Lobbyists, Bearing Gifts, Pursue Attorneys General
articles.snippet: Attorneys general have become the object of pursuit by lobbyists who use campaign contributions, personal appeals and other means to sway investigations or negotiate favorable deals, an investigation by The New York Times has found.
articles.abstract: Attorneys general have become the object of pursuit by lobbyists who use campaign contributions, personal appeals and other means to sway investigations or negotiate favorable deals, an investigation by The New York Times has found.
articles.lead_paragraph: When the executives who distribute 5-Hour Energy, the popular caffeinated drinks, learned that attorneys general in more than 30 states were investigating allegations of deceptive advertising — a serious financial threat to the company — they moved quickly to shut the investigations down, one state at a time.

articles.headline: Joni Ernst’s Playbook, for Women to Win Men’s Vote
articles.snippet: In running for the Senate in Iowa, Joni Ernst has helped write a new playbook for Republican female candidates by building a surprisingly enthusiastic base of support — among men.
articles.abstract: In running for the Senate in Iowa, Joni Ernst has helped write a new playbook for Republican female candidates by building a surprisingly enthusiastic base of support — among men.
articles.lead_paragraph: HAMLIN, Iowa — Joni Ernst, the Republican Senate nominee in Iowa, motors along the state’s back roads in a tour bus festooned with giant images of herself, an American flag, a cornfield and the tag line: “Mother. Soldier. Independent Leader.”

articles.headline: Amazon’s Grand Design in Devices
articles.snippet: The overall strategy behind the retailer’s hardware lineup appears puzzling. Its devices sound fantastic in theory but often fall short.
articles.abstract: The overall strategy behind the retailer’s hardware lineup appears puzzling. Its devices sound fantastic in theory but often fall short.
articles.lead_paragraph: Amazon introduces new gadgets the way a guerrilla army prepares for attack: unsteadily at first, and then with unexpected ferocity.
